result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10/14/15 bail refund notice/affidavit mailed to surety.

Defendant Robert R Mack in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

This case was scheduled for a trial in Judge Dallet's Court.
Judge Kremers has agreed to hear this case for Judge Dallet.
Defendant wants to change his plea.
. On motion of the state and pursuant to negotiations, court ordered this case dismissed and read-in for sentencing.

JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed. (missed office contact)  rmm
JusticePoint Violation Report received and filed.

Defendant Robert Ray Mack in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for jury trial.  Court has another trial that has to be heard.  State revoked the offer to the defendant.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.   rmm

Defendant Robert Ray Mack in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Final Pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 7/20/15 in Branch 40.  State put the offer on the record and then withdrew it.  Court reminds defendant the no contact order remains in effect.

15RM022933  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
05/01/2015

Attorney Gregory A. Renden in court, defendant Robert Ray Mack not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
BRANCH 23 FOR BRANCH 40
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court. Court Granted state's motion for joinder of 15CF1494 & 15CM1046. Case set for Speedy Jury Trial in branch 40. Case adjourend to branch 40.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Case set for scheduling conference and bail/bond hearing. Court is in trial. Branch 23 agreed to hear the matter. Case sent there forthwith.
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.

Defendant Robert Ray Mack in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant Robert Ray Mack in custody. Ron Dauge for Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Department Officer Ralph McClain.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Defense to address bail at the next Court date. Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Chantia D.

Defendant Robert Ray Mack in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Robert Ray Mack in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Counts 2 & 3.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  

  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain a DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
